contentMetadata.content:
{{short description|Cruise company}} {{Infobox company | name = Azamara | logo = [[File:Azamara_Logo.png|250px]] | logo_size = | caption = | type = | genre = | fate = | predecessor = | successor = | foundation = 2007 | founder = [[Royal Caribbean Group]] | defunct = | location_city = | location = [[Miami]], [[Florida]], [[United States]] | locations = | area_served = Worldwide | key_people = | industry = [[Tourism]] | products = [[Cruise ship|Cruises]] | services = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | aum = | assets = | equity = | owner = | num_employees = | parent = [[Sycamore Partners]] | divisions = | subsid = | homepage = {{URL|www.azamara.com}} | footnotes = }} '''Azamara''' is a [[cruise line]] based in [[Miami, Florida]], that operates four [[cruise ship]]s on worldwide itineraries.{{cite web | title = Azamara cruise fans will find the programs they love — and more — from new owners | last = Dolven | first = Taylor | url = https://www.miamiherald.com/news/business/tourism-cruises/article248918689.html | website = Miami Herald | date = February 4, 2021 | access-date = September 29, 2021}} ==History== Azamara Cruises was founded in 2007 after two R-class ships from [[Pullmantur Cruises]] that would have gone to [[Celebrity Cruises]] were transferred to the new company. The first ships of the company were the ''Azamara Quest'' and ''Azamara Journey''. They make cruises to exotic locations, competing with Oceania Cruises. Azamara became quite famous and in 2009 underwent a rebranding, being renamed to Azamara Club Cruises. Between 2012 and 2013 the ''Azamara Quest'' and ''Azamara Journey'' were renovated and in 2018 the company acquired the ''Adonia'' from P&O Cruises, renaming it to ''Azamara Pursuit''.{{Cite news|url=https://www.cruiseindustrynews.com/cruise-news/18713-azamara-signs-for-ownership-of-pursuit.html|title=Azamara Signs for Ownership of Pursuit|website=CIN|date=14 March 2018|access-date=14 March 2018|language=en-GB}} The company was founded by Royal Caribbean who wanted to diversify its operations. In 2021, due to the [[COVID-19 pandemic on cruise ships|COVID-19 pandemic]], the company was sold to a private investment group.{{cite web | last = Faust | first = Chris Gray | last2 = McDaniel | first2 = Colleen | title = Azamara Cruise History | website = Cruise Critic | date = January 27, 2021 | url = https://www.cruisecritic.com/articles.cfm?ID=3076 | access-date = September 29, 2021 }} The ships were extensively renovated from 2012 to 2013 and 2018, respectively. Azamara currently operates four ships. They belong to the eight R-class ships that were built for [[Renaissance Cruises]] between 1997 and 2001. The ''Azamara Quest'' and ''Azamara Journey'' both entered service in 2000 under the original names ''R Six'' and ''R Seven''. In March 2018, ''Adonia'' was also taken over from P&O Cruises and renamed ''Azamara Pursuit''. Each of the ships can carry a maximum of 686 passengers. All ships sail under the flag of Malta. Azamara offers cruises with the ships worldwide. In January 2021, [[Royal Caribbean Group|Royal Caribbean]] announced that it would sell Azamara to [[Sycamore Partners]] in the first quarter of 2021.{{cite web | last = Chang | first = Brittany | title = Royal Caribbean has sold its Azamara brand including 4 ships for $201 million as the company continues to push back 2021 sail dates | website = Business Insider | date = March 19, 2021 | url = https://www.businessinsider.com/royal-caribbean-sell-azamara-cruise-brand-coronavirus-2021-1 | access-date = September 29, 2021}} The sale was completed in March 2021.{{cite web | title = Royal Caribbean Group completes the sale of its Azamara brand to Sycamore Partners | website = Sycamore Partners | date = March 19, 2021 | url = http://www.sycamorepartners.com/news/article/2066 | access-date = September 29, 2021}} The acquisition of another ship, the ''Pacific Princess'', a sister ship to the other ships in the fleet, was also announced. It was handed over in March 2021 and was officially renamed ''Azamara Onward'' on May 2, 2022.{{cite web | title = Sycamore Partners Announces Plans to Add Fourth Ship to Azamara® Fleet | website = Azamara | date = January 25, 2021 | url = https://www.azamara.com/loyalty/news/sycamore-partners-announces-plans-add-fourth-ship-azamara-fleet | access-date = September 29, 2021}}{{cite web |title=Azamara Onward Officially Joins Azamara Fleet in Monaco Christening |url=https://www.cruiseindustrynews.com/cruise-news/27398-azamara-onward-officially-joins-azamara-fleet-in-monaco-christening.html}} == Fleet == The Azamara ships were built in 1999–2001 for Renaissance Cruises as a part of their {{sclass2|R|cruise ship|4}}. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Ship || Built || Builder || Entered service
for Azamara || [[Gross Tonnage]] || Flag || Notes || Image |- | ''[[Azamara Journey]]'' ||align="Center"| 2000 ||align="Center"| [[Chantiers de l'Atlantique]] ||align="Center"| 2007 ||align="Center"| 30,277 tons ||align="Center"| {{flag|Malta}} ||align="Left"| Previously ''R Six'', ''Blue Star'' and ''Blue Dream''. || [[File:Azamara_Journey%2C_Fremantle%2C_2018_(04).jpg|200px]] |- | ''[[Azamara Quest]]'' ||align="Center"| 2000 ||align="Center"| Chantiers de l'Atlantique ||align="Center"| 2007 ||align="Center"| 30,277 tons ||align="Center"| {{flag|Malta}} ||align="Left"| Previously ''R Seven'', ''Delphin Renaissance'' and ''Blue Moon''. || [[File:Azamara_Quest_(ship%2C_2000)_IMO_9210218%3B_Split%2C_2013-09-29_(1).jpg|200px]] |- | ''[[Azamara Pursuit]]'' ||align="Center"| 2001 ||align="Center"| Chantiers de l'Atlantique ||align="Center"| 2018 ||align="Center"| 30,277 tons ||align="Center"| {{flag|Malta}} ||align="Left"| Previously ''R Eight'', ''Minerva II'', ''Royal Princess'' and ''Adonia''. || [[File:Azamara_pursuit.jpg|200px]] |- | [[Pacific Princess|''Azamara Onward'']]{{cite web|url=https://www.lr.org/en/lrofships/|title=Lloyd's Register: IMO 9187887|accessdate=2021-10-16}} || 1999 || style="text-align:Center;"| Chantiers de l'Atlantique || style="text-align:Center;"| 2022 || style="text-align:Center;"| 30,277 tons || align="Center"| {{flag|Malta}} || Previously ''R Three'', ''Pacific Princess''. Was renamed ''Azamara Onward'' on May 2, 2022. || [[File:Kreuzfahrtschiff-AzamaraOnward-Portovenere-Ligurien-Italien.jpg|200px]] |} == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category|Azamara Cruises}} *[https://www.azamara.com Official website] {{Azamara Ships}} [[Category:Cruise lines]] [[Category:Transport companies established in 2007]] [[Category:2021 mergers and acquisitions]]
contentMetadata.text: Azamara is a cruise line based in Miami, Florida, that operates four cruise ships on worldwide itineraries. Azamara Cruises was founded in 2007 after two R-class ships from Pullmantur Cruises that would have gone to Celebrity Cruises were transferred to the new company. The first ships of the company were the Azamara Quest and Azamara Journey. They make cruises to exotic locations, competing with Oceania Cruises. Azamara became quite famous and in 2009 underwent a rebranding, being renamed to Azamara Club Cruises. Between 2012 and 2013 the Azamara Quest and Azamara Journey were renovated and in 2018 the company acquired the Adonia from P&O Cruises, renaming it to Azamara Pursuit. The company was founded by Royal Caribbean who wanted to diversify its operations. In 2021, due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the company was sold to a private investment group. The ships were extensively renovated from 2012 to 2013 and 2018, respectively. Azamara currently operates four ships. They belong to the eight R-class ships that were built for Renaissance Cruises between 1997 and 2001. The Azamara Quest and Azamara Journey both entered service in 2000 under the original names R Six and R Seven. In March 2018, Adonia was also taken over from P&O Cruises and renamed Azamara Pursuit. Each of the ships can carry a maximum of 686 passengers. All ships sail under the flag of Malta. Azamara offers cruises with the ships worldwide. In January 2021, Royal Caribbean announced that it would sell Azamara to Sycamore Partners in the first quarter of 2021. The sale was completed in March 2021. The acquisition of another ship, the Pacific Princess, a sister ship to the other ships in the fleet, was also announced. It was handed over in March 2021 and was officially renamed Azamara Onward on May 2, 2022. The Azamara ships were built in 1999–2001 for Renaissance Cruises as a part of their R class. Dolven, Taylor (February 4, 2021). "Azamara cruise fans will find the programs they love — and more — from new owners". Miami Herald. Retrieved September 29, 2021. "Azamara Signs for Ownership of Pursuit". CIN. 14 March 2018. Retrieved 14 March 2018. Faust, Chris Gray; McDaniel, Colleen (January 27, 2021). "Azamara Cruise History". Cruise Critic. Retrieved September 29, 2021. Chang, Brittany (March 19, 2021). "Royal Caribbean has sold its Azamara brand including 4 ships for $201 million as the company continues to push back 2021 sail dates". Business Insider. Retrieved September 29, 2021. "Royal Caribbean Group completes the sale of its Azamara brand to Sycamore Partners". Sycamore Partners. March 19, 2021. Retrieved September 29, 2021. "Sycamore Partners Announces Plans to Add Fourth Ship to Azamara® Fleet". Azamara. January 25, 2021. Retrieved September 29, 2021. "Azamara Onward Officially Joins Azamara Fleet in Monaco Christening". "Lloyd's Register: IMO 9187887". Retrieved 2021-10-16. Wikimedia Commons has media related to Azamara Cruises. Official website

Previously R Seven, Delphin Renaissance and Blue Moon.
Previously R Eight, Minerva II, Royal Princess and Adonia.
Previously R Three, Pacific Princess. Was renamed Azamara Onward on May 2, 2022.

Azamara is a [[cruise line]] based in [[Miami, Florida]], that operates four [[cruise ship]]s on worldwide itineraries.<ref>{{cite web

texts.title: History
texts.value:
Azamara Cruises was founded in 2007 after two R-class ships from [[Pullmantur Cruises]] that would have gone to [[Celebrity Cruises]] were transferred to the new company. The first ships of the company were the Azamara Quest and Azamara Journey. They make cruises to exotic locations, competing with Oceania Cruises.

Azamara became quite famous and in 2009 underwent a rebranding, being renamed to Azamara Club Cruises. Between 2012 and 2013 the Azamara Quest and Azamara Journey were renovated and in 2018 the company acquired the Adonia from P&O Cruises, renaming it to Azamara Pursuit.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cruiseindustrynews.com/cruise-news/18713-azamara-signs-for-ownership-of-pursuit.html|title=Azamara Signs for Ownership of Pursuit|website=CIN|date=14 March 2018|access-date=14 March 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref>

The company was founded by Royal Caribbean who wanted to diversify its operations. In 2021, due to the [[COVID-19 pandemic on cruise ships|COVID-19 pandemic]], the company was sold to a private investment group.<ref>{{cite web
 | last = Faust
 | first = Chris Gray
 | last2 = McDaniel | first2 = Colleen
 | title = Azamara Cruise History
 | website = Cruise Critic
 | date = January 27, 2021
 | url = https://www.cruisecritic.com/articles.cfm?ID=3076
 | access-date = September 29, 2021 }}</ref>

The ships were extensively renovated from 2012 to 2013 and 2018, respectively.

Azamara currently operates four ships. They belong to the eight R-class ships that were built for [[Renaissance Cruises]] between 1997 and 2001. The Azamara Quest and Azamara Journey both entered service in 2000 under the original names R Six and R Seven. In March 2018, Adonia was also taken over from P&O Cruises and renamed Azamara Pursuit.

Each of the ships can carry a maximum of 686 passengers. All ships sail under the flag of Malta. Azamara offers cruises with the ships worldwide.

In January 2021, [[Royal Caribbean Group|Royal Caribbean]] announced that it would sell Azamara to [[Sycamore Partners]] in the first quarter of 2021.<ref>{{cite web
 | last = Chang
 | first = Brittany
 | title = Royal Caribbean has sold its Azamara brand including 4 ships for $201 million as the company continues to push back 2021 sail dates
 | website = Business Insider
 | date = March 19, 2021
 | url = https://www.businessinsider.com/royal-caribbean-sell-azamara-cruise-brand-coronavirus-2021-1 
| access-date = September 29, 2021}}</ref> The sale was completed in March 2021.<ref>{{cite web
 | title = Royal Caribbean Group completes the sale of its Azamara brand to Sycamore Partners
 | website = Sycamore Partners
 | date = March 19, 2021
 | url =  http://www.sycamorepartners.com/news/article/2066
| access-date = September 29, 2021}}</ref> The acquisition of another ship, the Pacific Princess, a sister ship to the other ships in the fleet, was also announced. It was handed over in March 2021 and was officially renamed Azamara Onward on May 2, 2022.<ref>{{cite web
 | title = Sycamore Partners Announces Plans to Add Fourth Ship to Azamara® Fleet
 | website = Azamara
 | date = January 25, 2021
 | url = https://www.azamara.com/loyalty/news/sycamore-partners-announces-plans-add-fourth-ship-azamara-fleet
| access-date = September 29, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Azamara Onward Officially Joins Azamara Fleet in Monaco Christening |url=https://www.cruiseindustrynews.com/cruise-news/27398-azamara-onward-officially-joins-azamara-fleet-in-monaco-christening.html}}</ref>

texts.title: Fleet
texts.value: The Azamara ships were built in 1999–2001 for Renaissance Cruises as a part of their {{sclass2|R|cruise ship|4}}.
